item.title: 交易员看好特朗普获胜，比特币跃升至历史新高
item.description: 由于投资者倾向于唐纳德-特朗普赢得美国总统大选，比特币在亚洲交易中飙升至历史新高。【原文：Bitcoin surged to a record high in Asia trade as investors leaned towards Donald Trump winning the U.S. presidency.】

item.title: 任天堂 Switch 软件可在后续设备上播放
item.description: 任天堂总裁古川俊太郎（Shuntaro Furukawa）周三表示，该公司 Switch 游戏机的软件可以在后继设备上播放。【原文：Nintendo President Shuntaro Furukawa said on Wednesday that software for the company's Switch console would be playable on the successor device.】

item.title: 美国大选结果公布，波动剧烈的墨西哥比索跌至两年新低
item.description: 随着美国总统大选结果陆续揭晓，墨西哥比索兑美元汇率下挫，延续了近几天来该货币和其他货币的连续波动。【原文：The Mexican peso sank against the U.S. dollar as results in the U.S. presidential election started to roll in, extending a streak of volatility which has hit the currency and others in recent days.】

item.title: 文件显示，韩国锌业股票出售计划因监管机构的修订要求而暂停
item.description: 一份监管文件周三称，由于韩国金融监管机构提出修订要求，韩国锌业公司于 10 月 30 日宣布的新股出售计划已被暂停。【原文：Korea Zinc's new share sale plan announced on Oct 30 has been suspended due to a revision request by the South Korean financial regulator, a regulatory filing said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特朗普在出口民调中提前获胜，美元攀升；比特币上涨
item.description: 周三，美元广泛反弹，原因是在选情极为胶着的美国总统大选中，早期出口民调显示共和党人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）似乎占据优势。【原文：The dollar rallied broadly on Wednesday as early exit polls in the extremely close U.S. presidential election appeared to give an edge to Republican Donald Trump.】

item.title: 美国财报陆续公布，美股期货和美元在亚洲走强
item.description: 由于美国总统大选的早期结果表明选情仍悬而未决，投资者跃跃欲试，周三亚洲股市和美元纷纷走高。【原文：U.s. stock futures and the dollar pushed higher in Asia on Wednesday as early results from the U.S presidential election suggested the race remained too close to call, leaving investors jumping at shadows.】

item.title: 美国大选投票开始结束，WTI 原油期货下跌
item.description: 由于美国总统大选投票即将结束，美国西德克萨斯中质原油（WTI）期货周三下跌。【原文：U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures fell on Wednesday as presidential election polls were closing in the United States.】

item.title: 反应：随着大选结果陆续揭晓，市场倾向于 "特朗普交易
item.description: 在周二的总统选举中，共和党人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得了印第安纳州、西弗吉尼亚州和肯塔基州，而民主党人卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）则赢得了佛蒙特州。【原文：Republican Donald Trump won Indiana, West Virginia and Kentucky in Tuesday's presidential election while Democrat Kamala Harris captured Vermont, Edison Research projected, as polls closed in the first six U.S. states including the critical state of Georgia.】

item.title: 日本服务业活动因销售疲软而萎缩，信心进一步下滑，PMI显示
item.description: 周三的一项民间调查显示，由于担心劳动力短缺，日本10月份的服务业活动因销售疲软而萎缩，商业信心下滑至2022年3月以来的最低水平。【原文：Japan's service activity contracted in October on weaker sales, with business confidence slipping to the lowest level since March 2022 on concerns over shortage of labour, a private survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 9 月会议记录显示，日本央行在发出暂停信号的同时也看到了积极的经济迹象
item.description: 日本央行 9 月份的会议纪要显示，许多日本央行的政策制定者都认为，日本经济在满足进一步加息的必要条件方面正在取得进展，他们甚至支持暂停加息，直到全球市场的不确定性减少。【原文：Many Bank of Japan policymakers agreed the economy was making progress in meeting the necessary conditions for raising interest rates further, even as they backed a pause until global market uncertainties diminish, minutes of their September meeting showed.】

item.title: 消息人士称，珀莱雅以 90 亿美元的估值筹集新资金
item.description: 周二，一位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，珀客正在筹集新的投资，这笔投资将使这家搜索初创公司的估值达到 90 亿美元，这表明投资者对人工智能公司的热情有所升温。【原文：Perplexity is raising new investment that would value the search startup at $9 billion, a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday, a sign of heightened investor enthusiasm around artificial intelligence companies.】

item.title: 由于对中国和通胀的担忧，11 月份日本制造商信心不足：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社周三进行的月度民意调查显示，由于中国经济放缓和通胀率居高不下，日本制造商对 11 月份的经营状况信心低于 10 月份。【原文：Japanese manufacturers were less confident about business conditions in November than in October, a Reuters monthly poll showed on Wednesday, as China's economic slowdown and a persistently high rate of inflation soured sentiment.】

item.title: 亚洲 等待结束了......几乎结束了
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 特朗普传媒第三季度亏损 1900 万美元，原因是电视流媒体成本增加
item.description: 美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体公司第三季度净亏损为 1920 万美元，原因是与电视流媒体交易相关的法律费用和成本。【原文：Former U.S. President Donald Trump's media company reported a net loss of $19.2 million in the third quarter, due to legal fees and costs tied to its TV streaming deal.】

item.title: Spirit Aero 公司持续经营能力存疑
item.description: 美国供应商 Spirit AeroSystems 周二在一份季度文件中表示，公司持续经营的能力存在重大疑问。【原文：U.S. supplier Spirit AeroSystems said on Tuesday in a quarterly filing that substantial doubt exists about the company's ability to continue as a going concern.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会指控金融科技应用戴夫在预支现金方面误导用户
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周二在加利福尼亚州一家法院起诉金融科技公司戴夫公司（Dave Inc），指控该公司误导其个人理财应用的用户，提供现金垫款，但很少有人收到。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission sued financial technology company Dave Inc in a California court on Tuesday, accusing it of misleading users of its personal finance app by offering cash advances that few received.】

item.title: 超微公司称无法预测年度申报时间；股价下跌
item.description: 超级微电脑公司周二表示，它无法预测何时向美国证券交易委员会提交年度报告，特别委员会的调查结果显示，没有证据表明管理层或董事会存在欺诈行为。【原文：Super Micro Computer said on Tuesday it cannot predict when it would file its annual report with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and that the results of a special committee probe showed there was no evidence of fraud on the part of management or the board.】

item.title: 消息人士称，根据欧盟具有里程碑意义的《数字市场法》，苹果公司将面临罚款
item.description: 本周二，直接了解此事的消息人士称，根据欧盟旨在约束大科技公司权力的里程碑式规定，苹果公司将被欧盟反垄断监管机构处以罚款，成为首家受到制裁的公司。【原文：Apple is set to be fined by EU antitrust regulators under the bloc's landmark rules aimed at reining in the power of Big Tech, making it the first company to be sanctioned, sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊首席执行官否认办公室内全面授权是 "后门裁员
item.description: 亚马逊首席执行官安迪-贾西（Andy Jassy）在周二的全体员工大会上表示，要求员工每周五天在办公室工作的计划并非像许多员工所说的那样，是为了强迫减员或满足市领导的要求。【原文：Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said at an all-hands meeting on Tuesday that the plan to require employees to be in-office five days per week is not meant to force attrition or satisfy city leaders, as many employees have suggested.】

item.title: 工会称Stellantis首席执行官未确认玛莎拉蒂电动车计划
item.description: 意大利工会成员在周二会见了玛莎拉蒂首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares），但他未能证实此前宣布的玛莎拉蒂电气化计划，这加剧了人们对这个亏损豪华品牌的担忧。【原文：Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares has failed to confirm previously announced electrification plans for Maserati, Italian trade unionists said after meeting him on Tuesday, adding to concern about the loss-making luxury brand.】

item.title: 随着大众市场对美容产品的需求增长，Elf Beauty 的销售额将上升
item.description: 精灵美容公司第二季度的收入可能会增长近 33%，这是因为该公司的廉价化妆品在竞争中胜出，从而扭转了行业需求疲软的局面。【原文：Elf Beauty is likely to report revenue growth of nearly 33% for the second quarter, bucking weak demand in the industry as its inexpensive cosmetics edged out competition.】

item.title: 据彭博法律报道，Moderna 首席执行官 Bancel 辞去销售主管职务
item.description: 据彭博法律周刊周二援引一位知情人士的话报道，疫苗生产商 Moderna 的首席执行官 Stephane Bancel 将辞去该公司首席商务官的职务。【原文：Vaccine maker Moderna's chief executive officer Stephane Bancel will vacate his role as the company's chief commercial officer, Bloomberg Law reported on Tuesday citing one person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 波音罢工后，首席执行官必须解决公司内部的深刻裂痕
item.description: 结束罢工只是止住了波音公司的流血。现在，首席执行官凯利-奥特伯格（Kelly Ortberg）刚刚上任三个月，就面临着修复一个分裂、士气低落、渐行渐远的美国企业标志。【原文：Ending the strike only stemmed the bleeding at Boeing. Now, CEO Kelly Ortberg, just three months into the job, is faced with repairing a divided, demoralized, and drifting American corporate icon.】

item.title: HFR 数据显示，民主党入主白宫后，对冲基金表现更佳
item.description: 周二，在美国选民前往投票站投票之际，研究公司 HFR 的数据显示，当美国总统是民主党人时，对冲基金的平均业绩会更好。【原文：Hedge fund performance, on average, is better when the U.S. president is a Democrat, data from research firm HFR showed on Tuesday, as U.S. voters headed to the polls.】

item.title: 谷歌击败礼品卡欺诈诉讼
item.description: 联邦法官驳回了一项集体诉讼提案，该提案指控谷歌从 Google Play 礼品卡诈骗案中非法获利，拒绝退还从受害者处窃取的数百万美元。【原文：A federal judge dismissed a proposed class action lawsuit accusing Google of illegally profiting from Google Play gift card scams by refusing to refund millions of dollars stolen from victims.】

item.title: 自由港公司当地负责人表示，智利采矿许可证延期是个严重问题
item.description: 美国矿业公司 Freeport-McMoRan 的当地负责人周二表示，智利旨在加快采矿许可的改革长期拖延，给这个世界头号铜生产国的采矿业带来了 "严重 "问题。【原文：An extended delay in enacting reforms in Chile aimed at expediting mining permits represents a "serious" problem for the industry in the world's top copper-producing country, the local head of U.S. miner Freeport-McMoRan said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国服务业活动加速增长，创逾两年新高
item.description: 10 月份，美国服务业活动出人意料地加速增长，达到两年多来的最高点，就业率也有所上升，这进一步证明，在美国即将投票选出下一任总统之际，美国经济状况稳健。【原文：U.S. services sector activity unexpectedly accelerated in October to a more-than two-year high, and employment strengthened, more evidence that the economy is in solid shape as the nation heads to the polls to pick the next president.】

item.title: 共和党议员：美国需要打击中国芯片制造商中芯国际
item.description: 一位共和党高级议员指责拜登政府没有采取足够措施阻止中国中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司（SMIC）加强中国的芯片制造产业和军工综合体。【原文：A top Republican lawmaker has accused the Biden administration of not doing enough to prevent China's Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) from strengthening the country's chipmaking industry and military-industrial complex.】

item.title: 据俄罗斯卫星通讯社报道，俄罗斯法院因苹果公司未删除两个播客而对其处以罚款
item.description: 据俄新社报道，莫斯科一家法院周二对美国科技巨头苹果公司处以 360 万卢布（约合 36889 美元）的罚款，原因是苹果公司拒绝删除两段包含 "旨在破坏俄罗斯政治局势稳定的信息 "的播客。【原文：A Moscow court on Tuesday fined U.S. technology giant Apple 3.6 million roubles ($36,889) for refusing to remove two podcasts that contained "information aimed at destabilising the political situation in Russia", the RIA news agency reported.】

item.title: Expeditors国际快递公司第三季度业绩超出预期，主要得益于提前完成货运任务
item.description: 华盛顿 Expeditors International 物流公司周二公布的第三季度业绩高于预期，原因是一些托运人因担心港口中断和地缘政治紧张局势而提前转移货物，从而导致吨位和货运量增加。【原文：Logistics company Expeditors International of Washington reported third-quarter results above estimates on Tuesday, driven by increasing tonnage and volumes as some shippers moved freight early due to concerns over port disruptions and geopolitical tensions.】
